title: For Sale:  FROG LUBE
postcontent:
We are carrying a full line Of the NEW Frog Lube Products; from kits to individual cleaning items.   This product is new and performs above and beyond any other products that we have used.  Team LiveFire wants to share their new discovery with you.  Below is a full description on the product and how it came about.  It’s been on Magpul Dynamics, American Handgunner, Midway USA, and also will be coming to the new Shot Show.  Trust us you won’t be disapointed...  We sell all items on our web site as well and out of our store.  Like us on Facebook @ LiveFire Armory, and set up an account on our site @ LiveFireArmory.com for free.  

 FrogLube is a revolutionary bio-based gun cleaner, lubricant and preservative (CLP) product made from food-grade ingredients all obtained exclusively from US suppliers. It is a new “green” product developed for government use by San Diego-based Audemous, Inc, a company that evaluates products in the emerging environmental, safety and health sector.

    FrogLube was founded by CAPT Larry Lasky, US Navy SEAL (ret), who spent the past 32 years in service to the United States Special Operations Command, Naval Special Warfare and to the U.S. soldiers, sailors, airmen and marines whose gallant performance he attributes to every success on any mission and on any battlefield he has served. After a career of uncounted operations in every environment from jungle, to arctic, to maritime and desert, he’s seen the impact of these extremes on weapons and equipment. He felt the best equipment, products and weapons always came from combining the most arduous conditions and the solutions created by the world’s best field “operators”. He’s taken this ethos into product development with FrogLube, a new technology lubricant designed to replace inferior and toxic petroleum-based products that foul actions, attract carbon and stick to dirt and grime.


Biodegradable • Non-Hazardous • Non-Toxic • Nonflammable • Proudly made in the U.S.A

 FrogLube is a revolutionary bio-based gun cleaner, lubricant and preservative (CLP) product made from food-grade ingredients all obtained exclusively from US suppliers. It is a new “green” product developed for government use by San Diego-based Audemous, Inc, a company that evaluates products in the emerging environmental, safety and health sector.

    FrogLube was founded by CAPT Larry Lasky, US Navy SEAL (ret), who spent the past 32 years in service to the United States Special Operations Command, Naval Special Warfare and to the U.S. soldiers, sailors, airmen and marines whose gallant performance he attributes to every success on any mission and on any battlefield he has served. After a career of uncounted operations in every environment from jungle, to arctic, to maritime and desert, he’s seen the impact of these extremes on weapons and equipment. He felt the best equipment, products and weapons always came from combining the most arduous conditions and the solutions created by the world’s best field “operators”. He’s taken this ethos into product development with FrogLube, a new technology lubricant designed to replace inferior and toxic petroleum-based products that foul actions, attract carbon and stick to dirt and grime.


Biodegradable • Non-Hazardous • Non-Toxic • Nonflammable • Proudly made in the U.S.A[img]

title: For Sale/Trade:  Marlin 1894 css 357 Lever Action
postcontent:
This is the hard to find Marlin 1894css (Stainless Steel). The story is Marlin rolled these out for just a couple years 2009-2011, then Remington took over their operations and moved the factory from North Haven, CN to New York.

Since that move, no more stainless .357s have been manufactured, and if they ever are again, they will not have the "JM" stamp on the barrel that the original Marlins from the Connecticut plant had. 

I just watched one of these sell on gunbroker for $1,000 without the box. There's another on there now, it looks like a 6-day auction. Watch that one you'll see the demand.

The one here that I am selling has the box. The box is in good-to-fair condition. Included in the box is the factory offset hammer spur, a manual, and unopened trigger lock. 

I've taken the gun to the range twice, and fired 120 rounds--all factory .357 ammo. It will shoot .38 specials as well. It holds 9 .357s or 10 .38s in the tube. It is a very accurate point and shoot rifle. Performed perfectly. 

There are three slight nicks on one side of the stock. I've taken a photo with the light hitting them directly to show them completely. I had no idea these were going to become scarce, or I wouldn't have ever taken her out of the safe. 

The day I bought this gun at Sportsworld, what I really wanted was a Marlin Guide gun, but I didn't have enough money. Now it seems these css .357s are worth more to the right person than the Guides, so I'm looking to cash this one in and go get that 45/70. 

Have a box of Leverevolution .357s to throw in with the deal. If you want to trade a Marlin Guide, and you have enough extra ammo, we may be close to an even swap.

title: For Sale:  LOWER PRICE - Smith & Wesson S&W .357 Magnum Model 19-5
postcontent:
offered for sale is this classic Smith & Wesson .357 Magnum revolver. It has a 4" barrel, and is a model 19-5, SN 150KXXX (since I know somebody's gonna' ask!)

This pistol is no safe queen -- it's been carried and fired and has some finish wear to show for it, but you'll see when it's in your hand, it's tight and ready to fight -- very clean with strong rifling in the barrel, and little wear in the breach end. All the chambers are clean and shiny, the crane is tight and the trigger is just how you want it, a little light and very crisp. Rear sight is adjustable for windage and elevation.

The finish has wear at the high points, as well as the inevitable ring around the cylinder, a good bit off the muzzle on both sides and a spot under the right thumb – see the pictures, and notice the nice case-colored hammer and trigger.  It has extended Pachmayr grips with finger grooves that will fill your hand nicely without adding much weight or thickness.

$450 cash and it's yours! I prefer a face-to-face sale somewhere in the greater San Antonio area, and I'd likely travel a little way to meet you if you're serious. For another $5 I'll add in a nice soft case, or $10 for a lockable soft case. I also have a variety of .357 Magnum ammo which I'd be happy to work into a deal.Feel free to make me an offer, but make it a good one 'cause if I don't get full price I will sell it for the best offer I get.

NOW ALSO OFFERED ON GUNBROKER (Auction #296505100) ending tomorrow morning, and it had a $350 bid on it, so if you want it, now's the time!

title: For Sale/Trade:  30 M1 Carbine - Priced to move!
postcontent:
****  Price drop to $320  ****

(From $400 - It's priced to move.  New rifle I've been waiting on came in early + an impulse buy means I don't have room in my safe.  It's got to go.  Also throwing in available for trade - handgun that will fit in my safe or 410 or 20 ga  shotgun my friend wants.)


For sale is a Universal 30 Caliber M1 Carbine.
Rifle has all parts including 2@ 15 round magazines, the sling and oiler.
Also included is one 30 round USGI magazine.

Rifle shows age in bluing and on the stock, and is 100% functional.
It has only been 18 months since I did a full strip down, rebuilt the bolt (if you have ever worked on an M1 bolt you know what that entails!) and replaced most springs.

I'll also throw in a new box of Remington 110 gr SP ammo.
I am an avid reloader of over 30 calibers so I prefer to use low power ammo when plinking to reduce wear on guns and save the full load ammo for hunting.
I'll probably never hunt with a 30 carbine, so the kicker for me is that being a southpaw the brass from my reduced power loads ding me in the forehead if I don't pull my cap low.
Factory ammo and standard power reloads do as expected and fly over my shoulder no matter which hand I shoot with.
My safe is too full, so it is time for this one to move on to a new home.
The M1 Carbine is a lot of fun and I hope whoever purchases this enjoys it as much as I and everyone who handled her have had!

I will require proof of residency by Drivers License or State Identification card and will provide a bill of sale (copies for each).

title: For Sale:  NA! 3 rifles in 6.5x55 swede. m96/38, ag-42b, ljungman
postcontent:
This is basically geared to a Swedish or WW2 firearms collector.  Quite a bit of stuff in one place.  I have personally hit 18x18" steel with all 3 of these rifles at 300m standing - repeatedly. 

price: $2100 CASH.
all three rifles are in great shape and all chambered in 6.5x55swede - the greatest cartridge on Earth in my honest opinion. great bores and great shooters.  AG-42b with lighter stock - not shot much at all.  What are you getting with this sale:
1941 husky (husqvarna) M38 - serial: 602571. non threaded barrel. appears all matching (including bolt). Little chip on the stock (see pictures)
1943 (dark stock) Ljungman AG-42b - serial: 20593 - great shape and great shooter. buttplate matches - uncommon!
1943 (light stock) Ljungman AG-42b - serial: 21008 - great shape and great shooter.
if you do not know about Ljungman AG-42b - about 33000 ever made, equipment sold to Egypt and Hakim was born (looks a lot alike). 
3 bayonets with frogs.
2 Ljungman tool rolls - complete
2 swedish leather slings
10 swedish stripper clips (these work GREAT)
90 pieces of once fired winchester brass (6.5x55swede, obviously) in two new plano 50-slot boxes.
one rifle cleaning bottle with a brush.
1 magazine - long story, but I can only include one magazine pictured.  Hakim magazines or MG-13 25rd conversions work just fine with these (currently JB sells some hakim converted mags for under $100 ea), so you will have to either share a mag between two rifles or get some on your own. 

there are plenty of pictures, please ask for any other specific images if needed.
all of these are over 50yrs old = thus C&R eligible.
also listed elsewhere
price: $2100 CASH.
reason for selling:  well, I collect swedish mausers and Ljungman rifles + anything in 6.5x55 for that matter....  with that said, I need to raise $2100 fairly quickly.  If this sells first, well it is sold...however, if my SVD Dragunov sells first, I will take this lot off the chopping block.  So, I do not want to sell, I need to raise cash and these 3 rifles are duplicates anyhow of what I already own...  I do not own junk nor junk you will recieve :).

Few things out of the way:
a) $2100.00 is a firm price.  CASH! - no exceptions
b) not looking for trades
c) I do not do layovers, I am a private party
d) do NOT spam me
e) if you hit 'Contact Seller' button for more pictures/information - please include your telephone number where I can call you to discuss.  I am NOT going to pass it on, I just do not want my time wasted.
    Thank you for understanding.
f) I will ask for a copy of your WI DL and to sign a bill of sale - if you can't do that...well, no deal

slideshow: http://s1016.photobucket.com/albums/af283/audiobahn1/swedish%20lot/?albumview=slideshow

title: For Sale/Trade:  Milled AK 47 - Arsenal SLR 95
postcontent: One of the best AKs on the market.    Very rare AK variant.  Completely Bulgarian made.  Not assembled from parts kit and never demilled.  Very sturdy AK.  Steyr hammer forged chrome lined barrel.  Comes with US issue 2 point sling.  2 surplus mags, 1 Tapco mag, and 1 Polish polymer slabside.  Arsenal no longer makes this model.  The closest thing to it in the market is the SA M7 which is close to $2k.  If you can find a better deal on the internet then please don't waste my time telling me this.  AKs are getting hard to find and junk Century WASRs with crooked sights are going for $600.
